put.summary: Unload namespace
put.description: Unload an active namespace from the current broker serving it. Performing this operation will let the brokerremoves all producers, consumers, and connections using this namespace, and close all topics (includingtheir persistent store). During that operation, the namespace is marked as tentatively unavailable until thebroker completes the unloading action. This operation requires strictly super user privileges, since it wouldresult in non-persistent message loss and unexpected connection closure to the clients.

parameters.description:
The parameters applied to the auto failover policy specified by `policy_type`.
The parameters for 'min_available' are :
  - 'min_limit': the limit of minimal number of available brokers in primary group before auto failover
  - 'usage_threshold': the resource usage threshold. If the usage of a broker is beyond this value, it would be marked as unavailable

AutoFailoverPolicyData.description: The auto failover policy configuration data

namespaceRegex.description: The namespace-isolation policies attached to this broker

BrokerNamespaceIsolationData.description: The namespace isolation data for a given broker

serviceUrl.description: The HTTP rest service URL (for admin operations)

serviceUrlTls.description: The HTTPS rest service URL (for admin operations)

brokerServiceUrl.description: The broker service url (for produce and consume operations)

brokerServiceUrlTls.description: The secured broker service url (for produce and consume operations)

proxyServiceUrl.description: Proxy-service url when client would like to connect to broker via proxy.

proxyProtocol.description: protocol to decide type of proxy routing eg: SNI-routing

peerClusterNames.description: A set of peer cluster names

ClusterData.description: The configuration data for a cluster

brokers.description: The collection of brokers in the same failure domain

FailureDomain.description: The data of a failure domain configuration in a cluster

namespaces.description: The list of namespaces to apply this namespace isolation data

primary.description: The list of secondary brokers for serving the list of namespaces in this isolation policy

auto_failover_policy.description: The data of auto-failover policy configuration

NamespaceIsolationData.description: The data of namespace isolation configuration

adminRoles.description: Comma separated list of auth principal allowed to administrate the tenant.

TenantInfo.description: Information of adminRoles and allowedClusters for tenant
